name: spinynorman
text:
Interestingly enough, Eskimos only have about four words for snow. One thing that they have a lot of are - I think - demonstrative pronouns. Like, we have just "this" and "that," like "this one here" and "that guy up there."

They have single words for all of those. I believe there's around thirty of them. Odd, isn't it?

name: heath
text:
I don't know man, it seems like a pretty good leave to me. It says "I have class" on one hand, and "hey, fuck you" on the other. That's hard to pull off with a single thought.

Very well crafted to my eye.

name: apocowarg
text: And on the bright side it leaves Ray up a penny.

name: nutmeg
text: a penny off the price of dornheim's beer.

name: digdugz
text: Which becomes Ray's beer anyway.

name: tekende
text: But he's going to spend the penny in a bit. Cab's cost a penny.

name: apocowarg
text: Raymond Q. Smuckles owns Airwolf, he has no need for a cab.

name: tekende
text:
Why in the hell did I put an apostrophe in cabs

Why would I do this

name: rowboat
text: Because that grammatical situation owned you.

name: johnnyc
text: Plus, it was typed which demonstrates planning. THIS IS A MAN WHO KNOWS HIS LEAVE.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
This does nothing for my feelings about Dornheim.
Also, Ray's name in capital letters is reminiscent of the generated apology letters that Ray uses. Shame that the only flexibility in this sort of card would be the name at the top.

name: nikopol
text: A true master of Leaving uses 'fill in the blanks' letters heavily to reinforce the emotional distance between those he Leaves. Ray's usage of such letters in his apologies indicate that while he does possess the Leaving gene, it is latent at best.

name: postblank
text: Not to mention that he seems to have typed out his Leave letter in advance.  That's like Doctorate level leaving ability.

name: snack2deadly
text: he prepared remarks

name: falseprophet
text: THE MAN IS SO OLD SCHOOL HE WRITES ON THE CHALKBOARD WITH A QUILL PEN!

name: stuartc
text: He knew, down to the very minute, when he would leave. He's been playing Ray like a cheap fiddle.

name: oishii
text: The pre-meditated feel of Dornheim's leave makes me think that he couldn't pull off a good leave on the fly, without careful planning. To me, that is not a master of leavery.

name: rowboat
text: Argue nuances all you want, but the best thing about Dornheim's leave is that it culminated in his being gone.

name: molesticide
text: i hear THAT

name: puguglypress
text: Forever and ever, Amen.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
Exactly how I see it. It has all the sincerity and thought of Ray's apologies, and that is.. well-meaning at best, but not much altogether.
Still pretty funny, hehe.

name: nhennies
text: Dornheim is gone.  The only logical move for Ray is to knock a few back by himself, reflecting on the kind of leave that can only be executed by a Smuckles.

name: professorhazard
text: Fived for so many reasons.

name: wittyname
text: A comment left by wittyname was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by silver_lake, professorhazard, heath, chivalress, shades, theargentinian, Mastronaut, Appers)

name: chivalress
text: I think the "PS No cab has been called" (not even punctuated!) is what really puts it over the top.  I wasn't huge on this arc, but you have to respect a leaving like that.

name: flash1087
text: Insufficent fare for a cab that was never called. Truly profound stuff. I miss Dornheim already.

name: wae
text:
I hope I am not merely day-dreaming when I say that this feels, to me, like a portent of Great Outdoor Fight to come.

Ramses Luther Smuckles, I suspect, is the kind of "he finds you" dude who isn't even talked about in two consecutive strips unless he has decided that this is the way that things will be.

name: spinynorman
text:
The true drinking man has accompanying stationary.

This, along with all of Ray's drinkin' notes, and "From The Desk Of Dr. John Zoidberg," have made me waste dozens of dollars at the local stationary office. Dozens , I tell you.

name: wittyname
text: I knew I was going to be lamed so hard for that.

name: little_angry_plum
text: the guy above me got no less than seven lames for suggesting that there is such a thing as an "average achewood".  Seven people were offended at the concept that every achewood strip is not better than every other achewood strip.

name: theunity
text: Or, perhaps, that this particular strip was good and not bad. Take yer pick.

name: joebot
text: Average =/= bad. Average is actually pretty damn good, by Achewood standards.

name: lateadopter
text:
Average = Above Average
Achewood non-Achewood

name: lateadopter
text: Hey, those underlines suck!  And AssetBar deletes all extra spaces from whatever you type.  Fuckers.

name: kb
text: next time I am at a bar and feel the need to leave my present company, i will leave a note  similar to the one in panel six. and by present company, I mean dirty skanks

name: norrin
text: Why would you leave the bar to get away from dirty skanks? Aren't dirty skanks the reason you went to the bar in the first place?

name: wae
text:
I am a dedicated practitioner of just leaving the bar without telling anyone.

This is called the Irish Goodbye.

name: cailetshadow
text: I'm Irish and I take offense to that. We don't leave bars. (::typing from one::)

name: m1st3rbl4ck
text:
i always thought that was the Welsh Goodbye.
But, I'm Australian, so goodbyes is about twenty minutes of punches and hugs, an then sitting down for a few more anyway.

name: andrew_
text: He's also still wondering.

name: semiquaver
text: Wondering about *Google.*  By the way, Cudahy is a small city in southeastern Los Angeles County.  That is to say, California.

name: ttagxamm
text: Also a southside Milwaukee suburb, a working class neighborhood keg-deep in the sons and daughters of northern Europe.

name: miku224
text:
I grew up three minutes away from Cudahy, Wisconsin. Besides the bacon-makin' plant, there's absolutely nothing there of value.

Perhaps my opinion will change once I'm drinkin' age, what with the whole "we've got a bar on EVERY CORNER" thing.

name: mattylite
text:
bacon-makin':
[IMGS OFF]

name: nutmeg
text: that icon is tripping me out. i am so sad that i did not see Colbert do this on television.

name: pierceg
text:
I am Irish. I have never heard the name Cudahy. It does resemble an Irish name, although perhaps the spelling is so changed I do not recognise it, as happens to many Irish names brought over.

The other possibility is that it's Scottish (very similar etymology) or that the entire Cudahy clan emmigrated/died in the famine. This is common enough.

name: rowboat
text: I'm sure I'm way off here, but when I first read it, the name struck me as vaguely Indian sounding. Eastern Indian, I'm saying.

name: rowboat
text: Ah ha. Internet Magic prevails. I was thinking of Chaudhry. So never mind. Anything. Ever again.

name: streever
text: he is also five

name: clever-nickname
text:
tomorrow, i shall greet everyone with "what's the status, morning flatus?"

god, so awesome.

name: hcaz
text:
It's good, but it only works if you have the right accent.

If we did that here, it would go like this:
"What's the stATE-us,
Morning flatus?"
Us poor, poor New Zealanders.

name: phthoggos
text: what, you don't pronounce it "state-us"?

name: phthoggos
text: what, you don't pronounce it "flate-us"?

name: thesyndicate88

text: it would be FLAH-toose.

name: lamewad
text: I still love how they say "Keh-beb".

name: rowboat
text: Some of you would say more correctly, but the rest of the world still won't be able to understand a word of it.

name: honesttom
text: I just had to transcribe a load of dictation tapes from a New Zealand speech therapist, so I can only say amen.

name: sncether
text: As a former transcriptionist, I feel compelled to give you a commiserate chubby.

text: Actually, you'd say "mur currictly".

name: zek
text: Don't do that.

name: terrainasaur
text: so good, this turn of phrase, just for the fact that it invokes the image of ray premeditating it on his way back from the bathroom. the phrase's mediocrity only adds to it.

name: carpetbag
text: Having spent the entire storyline in suspense over whether Ray actually liked Dornheim, I am pleased to see that the answer is yes. Ever since Mark Twain I've had the darnedest time telling when Ray genuinely likes a dude.

name: mikeleffel2
text:
THAT WAS A FINE, HEARTY ENDING MR. ONSTAD!!

Bravo! Loved the penny-note! :) :) :)

I doubt you read these! :D

This one time, when I went to England, they stamped my passport, "Leave To Enter"...

I am not at all certain I did this correctly...

GULP

GULP

Slowly dragging one's mouse pointer up the the "X" in the top right of your browser window pretty much the antithesis of a good leave.

I sure hope we've all got a strong enough case of the dignities to eschew that option.

Dornheim, so insensitive to the Inuit people. The penny? Both a gift and a slap to the face.

5 for sure

text: Whoa, that Dornheim will totally flip a leave on you! Watch out for that sneaky snake-in-the-grass. One second you think you're doing the leave, and the next you been LEFT!

name: lateadopter
text: Stuart and lateadopter are so literal-minded that they have never recognized a joke.

text: How long do I have to wait before someone says, "In Soviet Russia, joke recognize you !" Oh, wait. Fuck. Never mind.

text: In Soviet Russia, yolk have chicken!

name: stuart
text: i need to call my dm and see if you made your saving throw 6 months ago under 4th edition

name: latterman
text: Where I live (which is the western coast of Puerto Rico), some floppy-clothed, thin-browed representative of the local hip-hop culture and his glorified blow-up doll would have taken the note, stopped reading at "This should cover it", and gone outside to see if they couldn't score a free cab ride.

name: latterman
text: Oh, and this is all while I unloaded- urinal-style -in the men's room.

name: jordstar
text: I just tried to smush your avatar on my screen. Damn ungodly hour to be awake reading Achewood.

name: loneal
text: I try to smush it every damn time I see it, ungodly hour or no. Every damn time.

name: ttagxamm
text: The escape key, my friends, will stop that bug like flypaper.

name: squi
text: So how do I stop stopping it? I'm finding myself compulsively reloading the page just to stop the bug again.

name: shoinan
text: Did the fact that there were two of the bugs moving in pixeled sychronicity not tweak a little doubt in you pre-smushing?

name: biff
text:
So, all these people have homes that are so bug-infested that they don't question whether the bug is real, they just automatically try to smash it.

Do they have bug smushes all over everything else in their homes?

name: honesttom
text: It is quite insolent for two insects to march in perfect time like they wuz people or somethin. I'd probably smush them just for being uppity sumbitches.

name: johnmatrix
text: Mental chubbies for each post from latterman to honesttom.

name: foetus_punch
text: Phillipe saying "uppity sumbitches" is more terrifying than getting yelled at by God.

name: dropkickpikachu
text: DAMN your avatar, there's one more fingerprint on my monitor this evening.

name: aaron_haynes
text: Another, better example of Ray doing some good leavery: http://achewood.com/index.php?date=05122006

name: soupkaty
text:
does it look to anyone else like it says domheim instead of dornheim in the note?
dunno.
like a different level of leave if that's right.
like, "i'm gone and really, you didn't even meet me."

name: rogergs
text:
Ray making do in the loo is "something to think about"?

That wacky Dornheim.

name: pkitty
text:
Well, assuming that we won't be seeing Dornheim for a little while at least, I've got to say that except for the very classy leave, here, I found him fairly boring. S'cool that Ray got to reminisce about his father with blood, though.

Dornheim and this mini-arc got threed, but that was a solid fiveful leaving (along with the truly slackful double-gulp at the end), so I'll split the difference.

name: mastronaut
text: The real magic with Dornheim is if he ever got to meet Beef for real. Dornheim seems to have a little bit of something for everyone; the brains of an Aviation Engineer and the crass of a Smuckles.

name: jordstar
text:
It almost felt as if he was conjured up just for the Leaving concept, but I'm sure we'll see more of him in the future and he will be fleshed out.

His moving bald spot gave me the heebie jeebies.

name: terrainasaur
text: i think that's just his hair shining. the thought of pomaded hair adds yet another confusing level of depth to this dornheim.

name: shades
text: Achewood is back. Best strip in a month or so.

name: rowboat
text: You and I enjoy Achewood in very different ways, apparently. And that's OK.

name: steerpike66
text: I must admit that, since I didn't like Dornheim, with his pen liner and his aviators and his beardy little teeth, I wanted him to leave, which he did, with a rudeness that bordered on grace, which means I now like him better, but do I want him back? I'm confused.

name: biondino
text: OMG did Dornheim wear a toupee??

name: stuartc
text: There's still something creepy about Dornheim's beard/mouth combo... I think he could be a ventriloquist's dummy, used by Ramses to test his son, or school him in the ways of leaving...

name: coolbreeze3
text: So. . . very. . . speechless. . .

name: roger_wilco
text:
Ray's leave is inherently better. It comes naturally. Dornheim may have one-upped him but he is certainly trying too hard.

On the other hand, any dude with on-the-fly access to a laser printer deserves to be respected.

Here's what I like about the Smuckles men%u2014they have a no maintenance relationship of the highest bond.

name: checkmatejones
text: Its a comforting thought to know that Ray considers the sneakiness of his blood relations to be as satisfying as some would consider the so called affection of theirs.

name: dicklaurent
text: Is Dornheim's note the first use of Helvetica instead of Arial in an Achewood comic? I love details like that.

name: luckyg
text: Dornheim cared so little for Ray's two cents that he actually returned half.

name: miku224
text:
lateadopter, if you read this, I'd like to retract my arguments from yesterday. After today's strip, I went back and re-read the last few, and you're right. Dornheim's ridiculous turns of phrase are not akin to Beef's tone. I thought we'd get more information about Dornheim, and this would make him a more believable character. Instead, he's gone, and I just feel confused.

It seemed like every new piece of background on Dornheim was surprising, but not in a particularly good way. I didn't think "his whiskey sours are famous ? That rocks!" It was more of a "why does this guy feel the need to brag about his whiskey sours?" And that feeling occurred in response to just about every single thing that Dornheim said.

In conclusion, I didn't really enjoy this mini-arc. But if Onstad's goal was to leave me bewildered and a little irritated, that's cool. Just so long as there's a good explanation later on.

name: lateadopter
text: Dude, you are a rarity on the internets.  You actually treated this like a discussion where people were trying to prove a point for reasons other than jerking someone's chain under the cloak of anonymity.  Chubby for that!

name: miku224
text: Be the change you wish to see on the internets, I guess.

name: rowboat
text: Whoa, is that Mao?

name: jackparsons
text: Alan Watts

name: illuminatedwax
text: Dornheim had let him in on the secret of his first name *from the beginning*

name: thatcrazycommie
text: It is really bothering me that I have no idea how Dornheim printed that.

name: phy
text: He prepared it a week before, in his own office, on his own letterhead. Dornheim has been doing this to people for ages .

name: 1000hz
text:
Dornheim's letter is addressed so informally.

Not even a "To Ray it may concern:"

name: themacktruck
text: Why has Ray looked like he's shaking this entire ark?

name: rowboat
text:
[IMGS OFF]
[IMGS OFF]

name: themacktruck
text:
Well played sir. Well played.
I stared at those for a few seconds thinking "Hurr... why's he got a picture of Noah's Ark and the Ark of the Covenant? Hurr...

name: rowboat
text: Just good-natured ribbing. Anyway, I noticed his shakiness, as well. I think Dornheim's just laying some pretty heavy shit on him and Ray's quaking with the excitement of discovery. Meanwhile, I'm waiting for this "ark" to sail away.

name: lastlarf
text: I'd like it to be stolen by Nazis.

name: lugand9
text: The saddest part is that Dornheim made sure to tell Ray there was no cab.  As if the poor bastard still had any hope left...

name: lateadopter
text: Ramses Luther would have let Ray wait for the cab and figure it out himself.  Dornheim is soft.

name: honesttom
text:
I think it shows more sass, as if to say, "I honestly believe you'll be stupid enough to believe I've called you a cab, so I'm going to spell it out because it would just get pitiful after a while, watching you standing there, waiting for a cab."

That's exactly what it says, in exactly those words.

name: ruralelectric
text: What i get out of this strip is two cats wanting to connect with their father in the worst way. Ray, upon finding out that Ramsies won the GOF, not only won the fight himself, but changed the game entirely. Dornheim's only experience with his father is Ramsies silently walking out on him in a liquor store. He took that experience and turned walking out on people into an artform. I may be way off but this may be one of the saddest situations in this strip so far, safe Beef of course.

name: ovenface
text:
I also think Dornheim was jealous that Ramses knew who Ray was and not him. I think this is a motivation for Dornheim to find Ray and leave with a pre-typed letter sitting on the table.

Ramses was a smart dude in a way; both his sons turned out great at what they do as a direct result of his absentee parenting.

The more I think about this, the more I worry about Onstad.

name: metrofeed
text: how did he type up that letter? Did he have it prepared in advance? What types of leaving letters does he keep with him at all times, and do they come with pennies?

name: epicurus
text: Though in fairness Dornheim does seem like the kind of guy who might carry a roll of tape on him at all times.

name: phy
text: Yeah, but gaffer or electrical tape, not scotch

name: nevlik
text:
I dunno. He seems like exactly the kind of dude who carries scotch tape because electrical tape is not the proper tape for pennies and paper.

A tape for everything, etc etc.

name: honesttom
text:
I imagine he does extensive research beforehand, then meets people secure in the knowledge of how he will play them, when and how he will take his leave. A means of connecting to the father he never knew.

Hmm, now I come to think of it, Ramses is a dick.

name: woodenteeth
text: The main problem here is that Ray and Dorheim are both fucking hopeless. The kind of men who are so emotionally retarded by their upbringing that this type of "I really wanted to find out who you are" but now must disappear like my dad, is just the worse kind of perpetuation of their own treatment. Boo to both of 'em.

name: jamsok
text: assetbar is all like "No, bitch, don't post again, bitch be cool!" In other news, what the deuce is the origin of the name Cudahy?

name: lateadopter
text: Still don't know, but Patrick Cudahy sells "sweet apple-wood smoked bacons" at www.patrickcudahy.com.  Maybe it will show up in the Bacon of the Month Club.  Onstad skipped from Bacon No. 5 to Bacon No. 8, so maybe it already did show up, and the sly dog just didn't tell us.

name: lateadopter
text: Okay, enough of you buggers couldn't be bothered to Google it, so I got curious. Cudahy seems to be from the Gaelic "O'Cuidighthigh," which means "descendant of the Helpful One." Reference here .

name: jollysaintpete
text: i want this arc to continue so bad it hurts

name: themaddoctor
text:
Hmm... is it better to say 'No cab has been called.' or just leave the readee to find outfor himself.

I suppose it would be a shitter to read a comic where you are left to find out. Am I shattering your suspension of disbelief?

name: lavosxii
text: I like to imagine Ray just sitting there, beers in hand, yelling the word gulp loudly and hoping that Dornheim hears him and feels ashamed.

name: hellofditties
text:
I remember finding this one hilarious the first time I read it.. I couldn't stop laughing. I can't see it now.

Sorry guys.

name: hellofditties
text: I'M REALLY TRYING HERE GUYS D:

name: i_love_kate
text: TRY HARDER AND GET BACK TO US HELLOFDITTIES

name: hellofditties
text:
I am so tired right now that I am just wondering why the cat has the symbol for pi on the back of his shirt.

I appreciate you reminding me that my life once had joy, though.

name: i_love_kate
text: Hahaha, fantastic.
